noun.description: An abundant rock-forming mineral typically occurring as colorless or pale-colored crystals and consisting of aluminosilicates of potassium, sodium, and calcium.

origin: Mid 18th century: alteration of German Feldspat, Feldspath, from Feld field + Spat, Spath spar (see spar). The form felspar is by mistaken association with German Fels rock.
